channel.title: Latest News and News Headlines | Daily Telegraph

item.title: Norway marks decade since Breivik massacre with anti-extremism plea
item.description: Survivors of Norway's worst massacre since World War II called on Thursday for the country to stand up against the hatred that motivated right-wing extremist Anders Behring Breivik's killing spree exactly 10 years ago.

item.title: China says WHO plan to audit labs in Covid origins probe ‘arrogant’
item.description: China on Thursday said a WHO proposal to audit Chinese labs as part of further investigation into the origins of the coronavirus pandemic showed "disrespect" and "arrogance towards science".

item.title: Madagascar says it foiled bid to assassinate president, six arrested
item.description: Madagascar said Thursday it had foiled an attempt to assassinate President Andry Rajoelina and arrested six people, two of whom were French nationals.

item.title: Reason petrol will get cheaper
item.description: Australian petrol is expected to get cheaper after a decision to increase global fuel production.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics opening ceremony director fired over old Holocaust skit
item.description: Tokyo 2020 organisers on Thursday fired the show director for the Olympic opening ceremony on the eve of the event over a decades-old skit referencing the Holocaust, in the latest blow for organisers of the pandemic-delayed Games.

item.title: Chinese city picks through the debris after record rains kill 33
item.description: Piles of cars were strewn across a central Chinese city Thursday as shocked residents picked through the debris of a historic deluge that claimed at least 33 lives, with rescue efforts ongoing and hundreds seeking to find their relatives.

item.title: Ceremonies chief sacked on eve of troubled Tokyo Olympics
item.description: The director of the Tokyo Olympics opening ceremony was fired for jokes about the Holocaust on Thursday, causing fresh embarrassment a day before the pandemic-delayed Games finally get under way.

item.title: 860-day first in ‘wild’ NRL clash
item.description: The brave and brutal Raiders prevailed in the most ferocious and physical game of football seen in the NRL this year to upset the Eels 12-10 and fire up their finals chances.

item.title: Fowler guides Fever to big win
item.description: A signature effort from star goaler Jhaniele Fowler has helped West Coast Fever underline their Super Netball championship credentials with a 64-50 drubbing of the Melbourne Vixens in their rescheduled round 8 clash.

item.title: ‘Harsh’: NRL coach takes aim at Broncos
item.description: Craig Bellamy has called the Broncos’ decision to bench Melbourne-bound Origin star Xavier Coates “a little bit harsh”, questioning what the relegation would do to Coates’ confidence.
